availability.p: The text of the original item is in the public domain. The text encoding and editorial notes were created and/or prepared by the Walt Whitman Archive and are licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 4.0 International License (CC BY 4.0). Any reuse of the material should credit the Walt Whitman Archive. Permission to reproduce the graphic images of the original item has been granted by the owners of the original for this publication only.

notesStmt.note: The writing at the top of the verso appears to be a fragmentary draft headnote to one of the 1874 New York Weekly Graphic articles in which Memoranda During the War was first published.
The following are responsible for particular readings or for changes to this file, as noted: Elizabeth Lorang Ashley Lawson Tim Jackson Brett Barney

It is one of the most encouraging & democratic tendencies of modern times

div1.p:
those quarters— having been lost in MS. in transmission by mail from P Philadelphia to the Graphic office, New York—the present number has to be substituted. ¶ Fortunately, each paper, is, for the casual readerâ€™s purposes, complete in itself. I but make almost random selections out of a vast mass of memoranda,—W. W. interesting and significant, if at all, of the vast & interesting, indescribable arriere of which
it is each piec here is but a rapid

sketch, or suggestion. W. W.
div1.ab: I collate some of them —notes of Soldiers, Hospitals, battles, &c to occupy & while away the the days days of my my tedious sickness, my paralysis, disabling me from bodily, temporarily. They are

Phantoms—a happily already gone, countless crowd, the obliterated group —Phantoms, but lately not long demise, terribly real graves of the past,
oblitera now
nearly obliterated, through bBut 10 years have intervened
